Key Match Events: Myziane Maolida scored a brilliant solo goal for Comoros in the 43rd minute to separate the two sides.
Ghana struggled to get an equalizer despite making several substitutions.
Comoros defended well to hold on to their 1-0 win.
Pre-Game Insights: Ghana had a slight advantage in their head-to-head record, having won three of their last six matches against Comoros.
Comoros had not lost any of their last three matches, having won two and drawn one.
Post-Match Reflections: Comoros coach will be pleased with their team's defensive performance, which secured a crucial 1-0 win.
Ghana coach Chris Hughton will be disappointed with his team's inability to score and create chances.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Moroni stadium in Comoros.
Comoros moved to the top of Group I with six points, while Ghana dropped to fourth place with three points.
Others: Ghana's goalkeeper Richard Ofori received treatment for an eye injury in the 33rd minute.
Comoros captain Youssouf M'changama was treated for a twisted ankle in the 46th minute.
